member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext
member.summary: Unifies the API for client and server gRPC call contexts; the API intersection is available directly - for client-specific or server-specific options: use .Client or .Server; note that whether this is a client or server context depends on the usage. Silent conversions are available.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Evaluates equality between values as defined by their .

member.summary: Evaluates a hashcodeas defined by the of the instance.

member.name: F:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext.Default
member.summary: Default context; all default client options; no server context

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext.CallOptions
member.summary: The options defined on the context; this will be valid for both server and client operations

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext.ServerCallContext
member.summary: The server call-context; this will only be valid for server operations

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Grpc.CallContext.RequestHeaders
member.summary: The request headers associated with the operation; this will be valid for both server and client operations

member.summary: The cancellation token associated with the operation; this will be valid for both server and client operations

member.summary: The deadline associated with the operation; this will be valid for both server and client operations

member.summary: The write options associated with the operation; this will be valid for both server and client operations

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.IGrpcService
member.summary: Marker interface for describing simple gRPC services. When a type implements this interface, the type name (without any prefix or other qualification) will be used as the name for resolving the gRPC service. All public methods defined by the type will be mapped as gRPC methods, using their declared name.

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.SimpleRpcExceptionsAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a service or method should use simplified exception handling - which means that all server exceptions are treated as ; this will expose the to the caller (and the type may be interpreted as a when possible), which should only be done with caution as this may present security implications. Additional exception metadata (, , , etc) is not propagated. The exception is still exposed at the client as an .
member.remarks: This feature is only currently supported on async methods that expose their faults via the returned awaitable, not by throwing directly; a more robust implementation is provided by the interceptor.

member.name: P:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.SimpleRpcExceptionsAttribute.Default
member.summary: Gets a shared instance of this attribute type

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.ServerExceptionsInterceptorBase
member.summary: A base interceptor that handles all server-side exceptions.

member.name: M:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.ServerExceptionsInterceptorBase.OnException(System.Exception,Grpc.Core.Status@)
member.summary: Allows implementors to intercept exceptions, optionally re-exposing them as .
member.returns: true if the exception should be re-exposed as an , false otherwise

member.name: T:ProtoBuf.Grpc.Configuration.SimpleRpcExceptionsInterceptor
member.summary: Indicates that a service or method should use simplified exception handling - which means that all server exceptions are treated as ; this will expose the to the caller (and the type may be interpreted as a when possible), which should only be done with caution as this may present security implications. Additional exception metadata (, , , etc) is not propagated. The exception is still exposed at the client as an .
